41  /**
42   * Wrapper to abstract out usage of user and group information in HBase.
43   *
44   * <p>
45   * This class provides a common interface for interacting with user and group
46   * information across changing APIs in different versions of Hadoop.  It only
47   * provides access to the common set of functionality in
48   * {@link org.apache.hadoop.security.UserGroupInformation} currently needed by
49   * HBase, but can be extended as needs change.
50   * </p>
51   */
52  public abstract class User {
53    public static final String HBASE_SECURITY_CONF_KEY =
54        "hbase.security.authentication";
55  
56    /**
57     * Flag to differentiate between API-incompatible changes to
58     * {@link org.apache.hadoop.security.UserGroupInformation} between vanilla
59     * Hadoop 0.20.x and secure Hadoop 0.20+.
60     */
61    private static boolean IS_SECURE_HADOOP = true;
62    static {
63      try {
64        UserGroupInformation.class.getMethod("isSecurityEnabled");
65      } catch (NoSuchMethodException nsme) {
66        IS_SECURE_HADOOP = false;
67      }
68    }
69    private static Log LOG = LogFactory.getLog(User.class);
70  
71    protected UserGroupInformation ugi;
72  
73    public UserGroupInformation getUGI() {
74      return ugi;
75    }
76  
77    /**
78     * Returns the full user name.  For Kerberos principals this will include
79     * the host and realm portions of the principal name.
80     * @return User full name.
81     */
82    public String getName() {
83      return ugi.getUserName();
84    }
85  
86    /**
87     * Returns the list of groups of which this user is a member.  On secure
88     * Hadoop this returns the group information for the user as resolved on the
89     * server.  For 0.20 based Hadoop, the group names are passed from the client.
90     */
91    public String[] getGroupNames() {
92      return ugi.getGroupNames();
93    }

131   /**
132    * Returns the Token of the specified kind associated with this user,
133    * or null if the Token is not present.
134    *
135    * @param kind the kind of token
136    * @param service service on which the token is supposed to be used
137    * @return the token of the specified kind.
138    */
139   public Token<?> getToken(String kind, String service) throws IOException {
140     for (Token<?> token: ugi.getTokens()) {
141       if (token.getKind().toString().equals(kind) &&
142           (service != null && token.getService().toString().equals(service)))
143       {
144         return token;
145       }
146     }
147     return null;
148   }
149 
150   public String toString() {
151     return ugi.toString();
152   }

154   /**
155    * Returns the {@code User} instance within current execution context.
156    */
157   public static User getCurrent() throws IOException {
158     User user;
159     if (IS_SECURE_HADOOP) {
160       user = new SecureHadoopUser();
161     } else {
162       user = new HadoopUser();
163     }
164     if (user.getUGI() == null) {
165       return null;
166     }
167     return user;
168   }

170   /**
171    * Wraps an underlying {@code UserGroupInformation} instance.
172    * @param ugi The base Hadoop user
173    * @return User
174    */
175   public static User create(UserGroupInformation ugi) {
176     if (ugi == null) {
177       return null;
178     }
179 
180     if (IS_SECURE_HADOOP) {
181       return new SecureHadoopUser(ugi);
182     }
183     return new HadoopUser(ugi);
184   }

186   /**
187    * Generates a new {@code User} instance specifically for use in test code.
188    * @param name the full username
189    * @param groups the group names to which the test user will belong
190    * @return a new <code>User</code> instance
191    */
192   public static User createUserForTesting(Configuration conf,
193       String name, String[] groups) {
194     if (IS_SECURE_HADOOP) {
195       return SecureHadoopUser.createUserForTesting(conf, name, groups);
196     }
197     return HadoopUser.createUserForTesting(conf, name, groups);
198   }

200   /**
201    * Log in the current process using the given configuration keys for the
202    * credential file and login principal.
203    *
204    * <p><strong>This is only applicable when
205    * running on secure Hadoop</strong> -- see
206    * org.apache.hadoop.security.SecurityUtil#login(Configuration,String,String,String).
207    * On regular Hadoop (without security features), this will safely be ignored.
208    * </p>
209    *
210    * @param conf The configuration data to use
211    * @param fileConfKey Property key used to configure path to the credential file
212    * @param principalConfKey Property key used to configure login principal
213    * @param localhost Current hostname to use in any credentials
214    * @throws IOException underlying exception from SecurityUtil.login() call
215    */
216   public static void login(Configuration conf, String fileConfKey,
217       String principalConfKey, String localhost) throws IOException {
218     if (IS_SECURE_HADOOP) {
219       SecureHadoopUser.login(conf, fileConfKey, principalConfKey, localhost);
220     } else {
221       HadoopUser.login(conf, fileConfKey, principalConfKey, localhost);
222     }
223   }

225   /**
226    * Returns whether or not Kerberos authentication is configured for Hadoop.
227    * For non-secure Hadoop, this always returns <code>false</code>.
228    * For secure Hadoop, it will return the value from
229    * {@code UserGroupInformation.isSecurityEnabled()}.
230    */
231   public static boolean isSecurityEnabled() {
232     if (IS_SECURE_HADOOP) {
233       return SecureHadoopUser.isSecurityEnabled();
234     } else {
235       return HadoopUser.isSecurityEnabled();
236     }
237   }
238 
239   /**
240    * Returns whether or not secure authentication is enabled for HBase.  Note that
241    * HBase security requires HDFS security to provide any guarantees, so this requires that
242    * both <code>hbase.security.authentication</code> and <code>hadoop.security.authentication</code>
243    * are set to <code>kerberos</code>.
244    */
245   public static boolean isHBaseSecurityEnabled(Configuration conf) {
246     return "kerberos".equalsIgnoreCase(conf.get(HBASE_SECURITY_CONF_KEY)) &&
247         "kerberos".equalsIgnoreCase(
248             conf.get(CommonConfigurationKeys.HADOOP_SECURITY_AUTHENTICATION));
249   }

253   /**
254    * Bridges {@link User} calls to invocations of the appropriate methods
255    * in {@link org.apache.hadoop.security.UserGroupInformation} in regular
256    * Hadoop 0.20 (ASF Hadoop and other versions without the backported security
257    * features).
258    */
259   private static class HadoopUser extends User {
260 
261     private HadoopUser() {
262       try {
263         ugi = (UserGroupInformation) callStatic("getCurrentUGI");
264         if (ugi == null) {
265           // Secure Hadoop UGI will perform an implicit login if the current
266           // user is null.  Emulate the same behavior here for consistency
267           Configuration conf = HBaseConfiguration.create();
268           ugi = (UserGroupInformation) callStatic("login",
269               new Class[]{ Configuration.class }, new Object[]{ conf });
270           if (ugi != null) {
271             callStatic("setCurrentUser",
272                 new Class[]{ UserGroupInformation.class }, new Object[]{ ugi });
273           }
274         }
275       } catch (RuntimeException re) {
276         throw re;
277       } catch (Exception e) {
278         throw new UndeclaredThrowableException(e,
279             "Unexpected exception HadoopUser<init>");
280       }
281     }
282 
283     private HadoopUser(UserGroupInformation ugi) {
284       this.ugi = ugi;
285     }
286 
287     @Override
288     public String getShortName() {
289       return ugi != null ? ugi.getUserName() : null;
290     }
291 
292     @Override
293     public <T> T runAs(PrivilegedAction<T> action) {
294       T result = null;
295       UserGroupInformation previous = null;
296       try {
297         previous = (UserGroupInformation) callStatic("getCurrentUGI");
298         try {
299           if (ugi != null) {
300             callStatic("setCurrentUser", new Class[]{UserGroupInformation.class},
301                 new Object[]{ugi});
302           }
303           result = action.run();
304         } finally {
305           callStatic("setCurrentUser", new Class[]{UserGroupInformation.class},
306               new Object[]{previous});
307         }
308       } catch (RuntimeException re) {
309         throw re;
310       } catch (Exception e) {
311         throw new UndeclaredThrowableException(e,
312             "Unexpected exception in runAs()");
313       }
314       return result;
315     }
316 
317     @Override
318     public <T> T runAs(PrivilegedExceptionAction<T> action)
319         throws IOException, InterruptedException {
320       T result = null;
321       try {
322         UserGroupInformation previous =
323             (UserGroupInformation) callStatic("getCurrentUGI");
324         try {
325           if (ugi != null) {
326             callStatic("setCurrentUGI", new Class[]{UserGroupInformation.class},
327                 new Object[]{ugi});
328           }
329           result = action.run();
330         } finally {
331           callStatic("setCurrentUGI", new Class[]{UserGroupInformation.class},
332               new Object[]{previous});
333         }
334       } catch (Exception e) {
335         if (e instanceof IOException) {
336           throw (IOException)e;
337         } else if (e instanceof InterruptedException) {
338           throw (InterruptedException)e;
339         } else if (e instanceof RuntimeException) {
340           throw (RuntimeException)e;
341         } else {
342           throw new UndeclaredThrowableException(e, "Unknown exception in runAs()");
343         }
344       }
345       return result;
346     }

353     }

362     /** @see User#createUserForTesting(org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration, String, String[]) */
363     public static User createUserForTesting(Configuration conf,
364         String name, String[] groups) {
365       try {
366         Class c = Class.forName("org.apache.hadoop.security.UnixUserGroupInformation");
367         Constructor constructor = c.getConstructor(String.class, String[].class);
368         if (constructor == null) {
369           throw new NullPointerException(
370              );
371         }
372         UserGroupInformation newUser =
373             (UserGroupInformation)constructor.newInstance(name, groups);
374         // set user in configuration -- hack for regular hadoop
375         conf.set("hadoop.job.ugi", newUser.toString());
376         return new HadoopUser(newUser);
377       } catch (ClassNotFoundException cnfe) {
378         throw new RuntimeException(
379             "UnixUserGroupInformation not found, is this secure Hadoop?", cnfe);
380       } catch (NoSuchMethodException nsme) {
381         throw new RuntimeException(
382             "No valid constructor found for UnixUserGroupInformation!", nsme);
383       } catch (RuntimeException re) {
384         throw re;
385       } catch (Exception e) {
386         throw new UndeclaredThrowableException(e,
387             "Unexpected exception instantiating new UnixUserGroupInformation");
388       }
389     }

396     public static void login(Configuration conf, String fileConfKey,
397         String principalConfKey, String localhost) throws IOException {
398       LOG.info("Skipping login, not running on secure Hadoop");

407   /**
408    * Bridges {@code User} invocations to underlying calls to
409    * {@link org.apache.hadoop.security.UserGroupInformation} for secure Hadoop
410    * 0.20 and versions 0.21 and above.
411    */
412   private static class SecureHadoopUser extends User {
413     private String shortName;
414 
415     private SecureHadoopUser() throws IOException {
416       try {
417         ugi = (UserGroupInformation) callStatic("getCurrentUser");
418       } catch (IOException ioe) {
419         throw ioe;
420       } catch (RuntimeException re) {
421         throw re;
422       } catch (Exception e) {
423         throw new UndeclaredThrowableException(e,
424             "Unexpected exception getting current secure user");
425       }
426     }
427 
428     private SecureHadoopUser(UserGroupInformation ugi) {
429       this.ugi = ugi;
430     }
431 
432     @Override
433     public String getShortName() {
434       if (shortName != null) return shortName;
435 
436       try {
437         shortName = (String)call(ugi, "getShortUserName", null, null);
438         return shortName;
439       } catch (RuntimeException re) {
440         throw re;
441       } catch (Exception e) {
442         throw new UndeclaredThrowableException(e,
443             "Unexpected error getting user short name");
444       }
445     }
446 
447     @Override
448     public <T> T runAs(PrivilegedAction<T> action) {
449       try {
450         return (T) call(ugi, "doAs", new Class[]{PrivilegedAction.class},
451             new Object[]{action});
452       } catch (RuntimeException re) {
453         throw re;
454       } catch (Exception e) {
455         throw new UndeclaredThrowableException(e,
456             "Unexpected exception in runAs()");
457       }
458     }
459 
460     @Override
461     public <T> T runAs(PrivilegedExceptionAction<T> action)
462         throws IOException, InterruptedException {
463       try {
464         return (T) call(ugi, "doAs",
465             new Class[]{PrivilegedExceptionAction.class},
466             new Object[]{action});
467       } catch (IOException ioe) {
468         throw ioe;
469       } catch (InterruptedException ie) {
470         throw ie;
471       } catch (RuntimeException re) {
472         throw re;
473       } catch (Exception e) {
474         throw new UndeclaredThrowableException(e,
475             "Unexpected exception in runAs(PrivilegedExceptionAction)");
476       }
477     }

479     @Override
480     public void obtainAuthTokenForJob(Configuration conf, Job job)
481         throws IOException, InterruptedException {
482       try {
483         Class c = Class.forName(
484             "org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.token.TokenUtil");
485         Methods.call(c, null, "obtainTokenForJob",
486             new Class[]{Configuration.class, UserGroupInformation.class,
487                 Job.class},
488             new Object[]{conf, ugi, job});
489       } catch (ClassNotFoundException cnfe) {
490         throw new RuntimeException("Failure loading TokenUtil class, "
491             +"is secure RPC available?", cnfe);
492       } catch (IOException ioe) {
493         throw ioe;
494       } catch (InterruptedException ie) {
495         throw ie;
496       } catch (RuntimeException re) {
497         throw re;
498       } catch (Exception e) {
499         throw new UndeclaredThrowableException(e,
500             "Unexpected error calling TokenUtil.obtainAndCacheToken()");
501       }
502     }
503 
504     @Override
505     public void obtainAuthTokenForJob(JobConf job)
506         throws IOException, InterruptedException {
507       try {
508         Class c = Class.forName(
509             "org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.token.TokenUtil");
510         Methods.call(c, null, "obtainTokenForJob",
511             new Class[]{JobConf.class, UserGroupInformation.class},
512             new Object[]{job, ugi});
513       } catch (ClassNotFoundException cnfe) {
514         throw new RuntimeException("Failure loading TokenUtil class, "
515             +"is secure RPC available?", cnfe);
516       } catch (IOException ioe) {
517         throw ioe;
518       } catch (InterruptedException ie) {
519         throw ie;
520       } catch (RuntimeException re) {
521         throw re;
522       } catch (Exception e) {
523         throw new UndeclaredThrowableException(e,
524             "Unexpected error calling TokenUtil.obtainAndCacheToken()");
525       }
526     }

528     /** @see User#createUserForTesting(org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration, String, String[]) */
529     public static User createUserForTesting(Configuration conf,
530         String name, String[] groups) {
531       try {
532         return new SecureHadoopUser(

545     /**
546      * Obtain credentials for the current process using the configured
547      * Kerberos keytab file and principal.
548      * @see User#login(org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration, String, String, String)
549      *
550      * @param conf the Configuration to use
551      * @param fileConfKey Configuration property key used to store the path
552      * to the keytab file
553      * @param principalConfKey Configuration property key used to store the
554      * principal name to login as
555      * @param localhost the local hostname
556      */
557     public static void login(Configuration conf, String fileConfKey,
558         String principalConfKey, String localhost) throws IOException {
559       if (isSecurityEnabled()) {
560         // check for SecurityUtil class
561         try {
562           Class c = Class.forName("org.apache.hadoop.security.SecurityUtil");
563           Class[] types = new Class[]{
564               Configuration.class, String.class, String.class, String.class };
565           Object[] args = new Object[]{
566               conf, fileConfKey, principalConfKey, localhost };
567           Methods.call(c, null, "login", types, args);
568         } catch (ClassNotFoundException cnfe) {
569           throw new RuntimeException("Unable to login using " +
570               "org.apache.hadoop.security.SecurityUtil.login(). SecurityUtil class " +
571               "was not found!  Is this a version of secure Hadoop?", cnfe);
572         } catch (IOException ioe) {
573           throw ioe;
574         } catch (RuntimeException re) {
575           throw re;
576         } catch (Exception e) {
577           throw new UndeclaredThrowableException(e,
578               "Unhandled exception in User.login()");
579         }
580       }
581     }
582 
583     /**
584      * Returns the result of {@code UserGroupInformation.isSecurityEnabled()}.
585      */
586     public static boolean isSecurityEnabled() {
587       try {
588         return (Boolean)callStatic("isSecurityEnabled");
589       } catch (RuntimeException re) {
590         throw re;
591       } catch (Exception e) {
592         throw new UndeclaredThrowableException(e,
593             "Unexpected exception calling UserGroupInformation.isSecurityEnabled()");
594       }
595     }
596   }

598   /* Reflection helper methods */
599   private static Object callStatic(String methodName) throws Exception {
600     return call(null, methodName, null, null);
601   }
602 
603   private static Object callStatic(String methodName, Class[] types,
604       Object[] args) throws Exception {
605     return call(null, methodName, types, args);
606   }
607 
608   private static Object call(UserGroupInformation instance, String methodName,
609       Class[] types, Object[] args) throws Exception {
610     return Methods.call(UserGroupInformation.class, instance, methodName, types,
611         args);
612   }
